record.text:
It is reality in this new AI world that dependencies change while you are writing code, in real time. 

The entire JavaScript eco-system is extremely volatile and fragile. Millions of lines of code change daily.

Modern software platforms are the opposite of robust. This is why Google releases a new browser version every week.

Modern programming is dependency h*ll.

Think how many updates your phone or laptop needs per year and triple it for a modern "be everything to everyone" platforms.

Cloud platforms, database platforms, dockers and K8s are all very complicated with "be everything to everyone" features.

Be everything to everyone is the antithesis of a black box design. A black box design is one that needs little testing because it is robust.

record.text:
等设备输出，应该就能取得实体的公仔或立体雕像。
最后，在此声明，本次建模中所使用的赤松小三郎和宫崎滔天的素材相片，分别取自柴崎新一著、信浓教育会编《赤松小三郎先生》（信浓每日新闻社，1939 年，PDF 第 7 页，国立国会图书馆数字典藏，https://dl.ndl.go.jp/pid/1684091）、宫崎滔天著《三十三年的梦》（国光书房，1902 年，PDF 第 2 页，国立国会图书馆数字典藏，https://dl.ndl.go.jp/pid/782062）以及国立国会图书馆「近代日本人的肖像」（https://www.ndl.go.jp/portrait/datas/339/）。

【使用 3D 模型生成器制作的赤松小三郎、宫崎滔天、世界人权斗士像（少女像）】
在当前充满挑战的经济环境下，仍持续快速发展的领域之一，便是 AI 领域。因此，本次作为近现代时期与日本及亚洲的民主化、人权、和平等议题相关的要素，特意选择了赤松小三郎（1831 年-1867 年）、宫崎滔天（1871 年-1922 年）以及世界人权斗士像（少女像），并使用中国3D 模型生成器（3D 建模生成式AI）将其立体化。
顺带一提，有些模型中，原本应该由赤松小三郎右手握持的刀却消失了，似乎是因为刀被视为凶器，在建模前的前期处理阶段中，被部分 AI 识别并排除所致。不管怎样，依据生成的电子文件，通过3D打印机

めちゃスパゲッティなPythonコードを理解して機能追加してくれるのえらいのぅ。

ちゃんとしたLexiconは、ほりべあさんの手元にあるだろうけどね。
myVoteは自分の投票がないときにフィールド自体がない状態で取得できるというとてもJSっぽい仕様で未選択の値（-1）をLexiconに定義してコード生成に反映するのも急遽やった（copilotがやってくれた）。

取得したJSONからlexiconをcopilotに逆起こししてもらったらそれっぽいのできた。

record.text:
OpenAI Is Paying Employees More Than Any Major Tech Startup in History

OpenAI is offering its employees significantly higher stock-based compensation than any major tech startup in history, with an average of $1.5 million per worker in 2025. This amount is…

Telegram AI Digest
#chatgpt #gpt #openai

external.description: OpenAI is offering its employees significantly higher stock-based compensation than any major tech startup in history, with an average of $1.5 million per worker in 2025. This amount is more than seven times higher than what Google disclosed in 2003 before its initial public offering. The average employee compensation at OpenAI is about 34 times higher than that of 18 other large tech companies in the year before they went public. To maintain its lead in the AI race, OpenAI is providing massive stock compensation packages to top researchers and engineers, making them some of the richest employees in Silicon Valley. The equity awards are contributing to the company's significant operating losses and diluting existing shareholders at a rapid pace. The pressure to increase employee pay intensified after Meta Platforms Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg began offering large pay packages to top executives and researchers at rival companies. As a result, OpenAI lost over 20 personnel, including ChatGPT co-creator Shengjia Zhao, to Zuckerberg's recruiting efforts. The company has given some employees one-time bonuses worth millions of dollars and expects its stock-based compensation to increase by about $3 billion annually through 2030. OpenAI's compensation as a percentage of revenue is expected to reach 46% in 2025, the highest among the analyzed companies, with the exception of Rivian. The company's high compensation levels are likely to continue, as it has discontinued a policy requiring employees to work for at least six months before their equity vests, which could lead to further compensation increases.
external.title: OpenAI Is Paying Employees More Than Any Major Tech Startup in History

record.text:
Security and Governance Patterns for Your Conversational AI

How many times have we heard people talk about the "dream of a SOC copilot?" A copilot woåuld allow an analyst to type something like, "Show me all the SSH login attempts for 10.0.0.5 over the last hour …

Telegram AI Digest
#ai #llm #news

external.description:
How many times have we heard people talk about the "dream of a SOC copilot?" A copilot woåuld allow an analyst to type something like, "Show me all the SSH login attempts for 10.0.0.5 over the last hour and compare those to the CrowdStrike alerts," and get the results instantly. This concept suggests the possibility of reducing mean time to resolution (MTTR) and providing Tier 3 knowledge to junior analysts.

However, in a secure environment, this dream may become a nightmare. In order to connect a probabilistic, hallucinating conversational AI (LLM) to your SIEM (Splunk, Sentinel) or EDR, you will require a fundamentally different security architecture than what you use for a typical chatbot. If the LLM can write to your systems, it could wipe out logs.
external.title: Security and Governance Patterns for Your Conversational AI

record.text:
今日のZennトレンド

【予言】2026年は論理ゲート式ニューラルネットワークが爆発的に進化する
この記事は、従来のAIモデルが抱える計算量の問題を解決する可能性を秘めた「論理ゲート式ニューラルネットワーク」に焦点を当てています。
2026年にはこの技術が爆発的に進化し、Transformerなどの既存のAIアーキテクチャに匹敵、または超える性能を発揮すると予測。
特に、演算効率の高さから、LLMや画像処理などの分野でGPUに代わる存在になる可能性を示唆しています。
また、新しい学習アルゴリズムや専用ハードウェアの開発も進み、AI技術の発展に大きく貢献すると結論付けています。

record.text: Solvitur ambulando is my favourite Latin phrase. It means "it is solved by walking".

images.alt: A photograph I took quite early on New Year's Day, 2019, while walking on the Isle of Purpeck, not long before I did a tweet using it, and the same caption. I imagine it won't have as much impact here, since loads of people have since reused it, and the phrase is now more widely known. It is still very very true, though. Lots of things are solved by walking. Although not everything, obviously.

https://togetter.com/li/2644909
ChatGPTを使って2025年の自分の全会話ログから強みと課題を分析する試みが紹介されています。

images.alt:
Title: New year's resolution 

A man sits at a table with a coffee writing in a notebook: “This year i will devote myself completely to reading serious, improving literature, forsaking easy pleasures and tirelessly seeking out truth and profundity in the work of the greatest writers.”

He looks at it
Says: Hmm... 
then “Scratch Scratch Scratch scratch” scribbles out words until the text reads: “This year I will read for Fun”

1月1日

友達が
「最近久しぶりにkomifloみたら知らない作家さんが多くて、あのひらがら7文字の人がとても良かった」
と言われて、すぐに「さんじゅうろう」さんと回答出来なかったのが去年悔しかったのだが「ほかにも7文字ひらがなの人居るのでは？」と思ってkomifloの作者リストをテキスト整形し、ChatGPTに読み込ませて総数686件中ひらがな7文字のペンネームは9件あった。
そのなかに「ねこふぐだんご」さんも居て「ガンジューさんみたいな素敵な絵を描く人いるんだなあ」とkomiflo初見間抜けなこと言ってたと正月早々コミティア同人誌を整理してると画像の同人誌出て来てふと思い出しました。
BGMとかつけられるのスペースより機能があって楽しそうだなあ
